Bend.Pilot Butte Inn: The Pilot Butte Inn was a hotel building in Bend, Oregon, in the United States. Designed by American architects Tourtellotte & Hummel, the inn was built in 1917 and exhibited American Craftsman style architecture. It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1972, becoming the first site in Deschutes County to be listed, but was demolished in June 1973.
